sections.name: base
sections.description: Core stock-market utilities for quotes, historical data, and symbol search.

endpoints.name: get_quote
endpoints.description: Fetch a real-time fast-info snapshot plus the most recent completed OHLC bar so an agent can cite price, range, averages, and liquidity metrics in one call. The payload merges Yahoo fast_info fields (bid/ask, 10/30 day volume, market cap, 52-week stats, timezone) with a pandas-style row for the last candle, making it ideal for quick status summaries or trade checklists.
endpoints.returns: Dictionary containing 'quote' metadata fields and a one-row 'data' array with the latest OHLC values.

endpoints.name: get_historical_data
endpoints.signature: get_historical_data(symbol, period='1y', interval='1d', include_chart=False) -> Dict[str, Any]
endpoints.description: Download normalized OHLCV history for any ticker with flexible period/interval arguments, optional explicit start/end dates, and automatic price adjustment. Agents can feed the response into custom indicators, chart renderers, or regression models because it returns clean arrays plus optional Plotly chart data when include_chart=True.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: ISO start date. Mutually exclusive with period.

endpoints.returns: Dictionary with metadata (interval/period) and serialized pandas DataFrame rows in 'data'.

endpoints.name: get_bulk_quotes
endpoints.description: Batch version of get_quote that accepts dozens of tickers and returns a dict keyed by symbol containing fast-info metadata, prior close, intraday range, and liquidity stats. Use it when building watchlists, sector dashboards, or when an agent needs to compare multiple names without reissuing individual calls.
endpoints.returns: Dictionary with 'quotes' list, one entry per ticker (price, currency, market deltas, timestamp).

endpoints.name: search_symbols
endpoints.signature: search_symbols(keywords: str, region='US', quotes_count=10) -> Dict[str, Any]
endpoints.description: Structured wrapper around Yahoo's symbol search that supports fuzzy text queries, region/exchange metadata, and graceful handling of empty results. Useful for turning free-form user input (company names, ISINs, crypto tickers) into canonical symbols before calling the quote, historical, or options endpoints.
endpoints.returns: Dictionary containing the original query/region plus either 'results' or an error payload.

example.message: Yahoo Finance API rate limit exceeded. Please try again later.
example.suggestion: Try searching for a more specific symbol or company name, or try again later.

sections.name: crypto
sections.description: Endpoints for cryptocurrency quotes and analytics.

endpoints.name: get_crypto_price
endpoints.signature: get_crypto_price(symbol: str, include_chart: bool = False) -> Dict[str, Any]
endpoints.description: Return the latest fast-info snapshot for a crypto pair (spot or perpetual) along with a short OHLCV history so agents can mention both the current price and immediate trend. The service normalizes symbols (e.g., BTC-USD vs BTCUSD) and always includes USD conversions plus market-cap/volume context when available.
endpoints.returns: Dictionary with 'quote' and up to 5 days of 'recent' OHLCV data.

sections.name: commodities
sections.description: Endpoints for commodity quotes and related analytics.

endpoints.name: get_commodity_price
endpoints.signature: get_commodity_price(symbol: str, include_chart: bool = False) -> Dict[str, Any]
endpoints.description: Provide headline quote details for liquid commodities such as gold (GC=F), silver (SI=F), crude (CL=F), natural gas (NG=F), and grains, alongside a lightweight historical window for momentum context. Ideal for macro commentary blocks or to correlate risk assets against raw materials.
endpoints.returns: Dictionary with 'quote' (fast-info fields) and 'recent' OHLC rows.

endpoints.name: technical_analysis
endpoints.signature: technical_analysis(symbol: str, indicators: List[str] | None = None, period: str = "1y", interval: str = "1d", include_chart: bool = False) -> Dict[str, Any]
endpoints.description: Compute a full technical-analysis bundle over the requested window using the internal indicator engine. By default it evaluates RSI, MACD, SMA, EMA, Bollinger Bands (BBANDS), Average True Range (ATR), and On Balance Volume (OBV); callers can pass a subset via the indicators list. The response returns each indicator's DataFrame plus the underlying price slice and optional chart payload, so agents can cite oscillator levels, moving-average crossovers, volatility envelopes, and accumulation metrics in natural language.
endpoints.returns: Dictionary containing indicator outputs under the "indicators" key plus recent price data.

sections.name: fundamentals
sections.description: Company fundamentals, financial statements, key metrics, and valuation data.

endpoints.name: get_company_overview
endpoints.description: Pull the company profile overlay (sector, industry, country, employees, description) together with market-cap tiers, beta, and listing info. Designed for generating narrative blurbs or validating that a ticker actually matches the requested asset before deeper analysis.

endpoints.name: get_fundamentals
endpoints.signature: get_fundamentals(symbol: str, include_statements: bool = True, include_ratios: bool = True, include_chart: bool = False) -> Dict[str, Any]
endpoints.description: Return a consolidated fundamentals pack that merges overview data, the latest income statement/balance-sheet/cash-flow snippets, valuation ratios, and growth metrics. Use it when drafting investment theses or when an agent needs both narrative stats and hard numbers without orchestrating multiple downstream fetches.

parameters.name: include_ratios
parameters.description: Include key metrics and valuation ratios.

endpoints.returns: Dictionary combining overview, statements, ratios, and optionally a chart.

sections.name: options
sections.description: Options chain retrieval, implied volatility analytics, and volume tools.

endpoints.name: get_options_chain
endpoints.signature: get_options_chain(symbol: str, expiration: str | None = None, include_greeks: bool = True) -> Dict[str, Any]
endpoints.description: Retrieve the full calls/puts chain for a given expiration (or the nearest expiry when omitted), including strike, bid/ask, last price, volume, open interest, and Greeks when available. Supports optional chart payloads so agents can highlight skew or open-interest clusters in reports.
endpoints.returns: Dictionary with expiration metadata, available expirations, and serialized calls/puts tables.

endpoints.name: get_implied_volatility
endpoints.signature: get_implied_volatility(symbol: str, expiration: str | None = None, include_chart: bool = False) -> Dict[str, Any]
endpoints.description: Build a summarized implied-volatility view for one expiration, returning average call/put IV plus arrays of per-strike IV that can be plotted into a smile. Helpful for quickly describing whether volatility is elevated, depressed, or skewed without dumping the entire chain response.
endpoints.returns: Dictionary with average call/put implied volatility and arrays of per-strike IV values.

sections.name: economics
sections.description: Macro indicators, treasury rates, and market sentiment utilities.

endpoints.name: get_treasury_rates
endpoints.signature: get_treasury_rates(include_chart: bool = False, chart_style: str = "plotly") -> Dict[str, Any]
endpoints.description: Return the latest Treasury yields for standard maturities (3M through 30Y) with symbols for each series and optional Plotly curve data, enabling agents to comment on curve steepness, inversion, or rate shocks inside macro briefings.
endpoints.returns: Dictionary with per-maturity rates, plus optional chart.

endpoints.name: get_market_sentiment
endpoints.signature: get_market_sentiment(include_chart: bool = False, chart_style: str = "plotly") -> Dict[str, Any]
endpoints.description: Fetch a consolidated view of volatility-based gauges (VIX, VXN, RVX, SKEW, etc.) alongside textual descriptions so agents can infer fear/greed regimes. Optional chart output makes it easy to embed comparisons of equity vs NASDAQ vs Russell volatility.
endpoints.returns: Dictionary containing sentiment metric values and descriptions.
